creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: male figure leaning on long staff against a tree; large herd of pigs behind him
inscription:
Signature, Inscription, Stamp

-- numbered in plate at upper right: 3
-- inscribed at top of print: [CVPIEBAT IMPLERE VENTREM SVVM DE SILIQUIS / LVCE XV]
-- in graphite on verso: a 45719 | B.33 II | 51 (above stamp)
markings: black stamp on verso, LR: Joseph-Guillaume-Jean Camberlyn, Lugt 514; brown stamp on verso near right edge: Adalbert von Lanna, Lugt 2773
portfolio: From Story of the Prodigal Son, Plate 3
provenance: Joseph-Guillaume-Jean Camberlyn (1783-1861), The Hague and Brussels (sales 1865-67). Adalbert von Lanna (1836-1909), Lugt 2773, Prague (sales 1909-11). [Kennedy Galleries, New York; sold to Andrus]; John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie; gave to MIA, 2015. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
title: Prodigal Son with the Swine, From Story of the Prodigal Son, Plate 3
